title: Ceres-1 rocket launches 8 Chinese commercial satellites
summary:
HELSINKI — Chinese commercial launch company Galactic Energy successfully sent eight satellites into orbit early Monday with its light-lift Ceres-1 rocket. The Ceres-1 solid rocket lifted off at 4:07 a.m. […]

title: NASA gets extension to submit layoff plans
summary:
NASA has received an extension to a White House directive to develop a plan for cutting the agency’s workforce, saying its current workforce has been too busy.
The post NASA gets extension to submit layoff plans appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Constellr releases  first-light imagery of Tokyo
summary:
German startup constellr released first-light imagery from the initial satellite in its thermal-imaging constellation.

title: Space National Guard debate reignited with bipartisan legislation
summary:
The new legislative push comes just months after Congress approved the Space Force Personnel Management Act, which eliminated the traditional distinction between active duty, Reserve, and Guard units.

title: NASA to Provide Live Coverage of Crew-9 Return, Splashdown
summary: NASA will provide live coverage of the agency’s SpaceX Crew-9 return to Earth from the International Space Station, beginning with Dragon spacecraft hatch closure preparations at 10:45 p.m. EDT Monday, March 17. NASA and SpaceX met on Sunday to assess weather and splashdown conditions off Florida’s coast for the return of the agency’s Crew-9 mission […]

title: Crew-10 arrives at space station
summary:
A Crew Dragon spacecraft with four people on board docked with the International Space Station March 16, setting up the departure of an existing station crew in the coming days.
The post Crew-10 arrives at space station appeared first on SpaceNews.
